page.title: 06Northfleet Fire Station
page.content: 1985 is the 100th anniversary of Northfleet Fire Station.All emergency fire calls in Kent go to Maidstone where there is a computer.The computer decides which appliances to use.If Northfleet Fire Station appliances are to be used a print out is received at the station.Also an alarm goes off and at night lights flash above the engine to be used.The print out gives details about the fire.The firemen then consult a hand written card index to find the best route to the fire.There are 4 appliances at Northfleet,3 water tenders and 1 emergency tender.The water tenders usually connect their hoses to fire hydrants.These are marked by yellow signs with a black H on.The water tenders carry foam for chemical fires.The emergency tender takes heavy lifting and cutting gear to accidents.
